headline.main: BEDARD, MOTTRAM WIN; Will Meet Today in Final of Tennis Tourney at Nice

docs.snippet: THIS is the month for international tournaments. The European invitation tournament at Monte Carlo, beginning March 17, has already been reported here. A strong United States team is going there to compete against the Europeans, who now (via the...
docs.lead_paragraph: THIS is the month for international tournaments. The European invitation tournament at Monte Carlo, beginning March 17, has already been reported here. A strong United States team is going there to compete against the Europeans, who now (via the British team) hold the world championship.

docs.snippet: Opposite movements in British, sterling and the Canadian dollar proved the absorbing topic of interest to dealers in the foreign exchange market last week.
docs.lead_paragraph: Opposite movements in British, sterling and the Canadian dollar proved the absorbing topic of interest to dealers in the foreign exchange market last week.

docs.snippet: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., March 6 (AP) -- March winds caused scores to soar in the third round of the $5,000 Jacksonville women's open golf tournament today --with a four-way tie for the lead the result.
docs.lead_paragraph: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., March 6 (AP) -- March winds caused scores to soar in the third round of the $5,000 Jacksonville women's open golf tournament today --with a four-way tie for the lead the result.

docs.snippet: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., March 7 (UP)--Mrs. Jackie Pung, the transplanted Hawaiian playing out of Cincinnati, performed steadily today to win the Jacksonville women's open golf tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., March 7 (UP)--Mrs. Jackie Pung, the transplanted Hawaiian playing out of Cincinnati, performed steadily today to win the Jacksonville women's open golf tournament.

headline.main: Mrs. Pung Triumphs by Stroke With 297 on Jacksonville Links; Cincinnati Golfer Registers 72 on Final Round--Three Players Tie for Second

docs.snippet: AUGUSTA, Ga., March 10 (AP) --Louise Suggs shaved a stroke off par today with a 71 in a glittering opening bid in defense of her women's Titleholders golf championship.
docs.lead_paragraph: AUGUSTA, Ga., March 10 (AP) --Louise Suggs shaved a stroke off par today with a 71 in a glittering opening bid in defense of her women's Titleholders golf championship.

headline.main: LOUISE SUGGS' 71 LEADS BY STROKE; Defender Paces Miss Faulk in Titleholders' Tourney-- Mrs. Pung Posts 73

docs.snippet: Boris Ivkov of Yugoslavia, Ludek Pachman, Czechoslovakia; Laszlo Szabo, Hungary, and Hector Rossetto, Argentina, were the winners in the opening round of the eighteenth international chess masters tournament at the Hotel Provincial in Mar del Plata,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Boris Ivkov of Yugoslavia, Ludek Pachman, Czechoslovakia; Laszlo Szabo, Hungary, and Hector Rossetto, Argentina, were the winners in the opening round of the eighteenth international chess masters tournament at the Hotel Provincial in Mar del Plata, Argentina, according to a report received from Buenos Aires yesterday.

headline.main: IVKOV TOPS PILNIK IN CHESS TOURNEY; Ex-Junior World Titleholder Triumphs in 42 Moves as Argentine Play Begins

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 7--On her recent Antarctic cruise the U. S. S. Atka skirted 7,000 miles for suitable coastline looking for suitable harbors. She pointedly by-passed the sector claimed by Britain, Chile and Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 7--On her recent Antarctic cruise the U. S. S. Atka skirted 7,000 miles for suitable coastline looking for suitable harbors. She pointedly by-passed the sector claimed by Britain, Chile and Argentina.
docs.abstract: Sullivan discusses Atka's bypassing Palmer Peninsula area jointly claimed by GB, Chile and Argentina

headline.main: ANTARCTIC ISSUES AVOIDED BY ATKA; U. S. Ship Skirted Palmer Peninsula, the Scene of Conflicting Claims

byline.original: By WALTER SULLIVANSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Boris Ivkov of Yugoslavia yesterday gained his second victory in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata. Playing the back pieces, he defeated B. De Greiff of Colombia, according to a report from Buenos Aires.
docs.lead_paragraph: Boris Ivkov of Yugoslavia yesterday gained his second victory in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata. Playing the back pieces, he defeated B. De Greiff of Colombia, according to a report from Buenos Aires.

headline.main: 3 SHARE FIRST PLACE IN ARGENTINE CHESS
